definition: a wizard's wand (notion borrowed from Western fantasy fiction)
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race

sentences.english: The magic wand is to love like Christ.
sentences.chinese: 這支魔棒就是要像耶穌那樣去愛。

sentences.english: So we use the wand to conjure up the book, pencils and erasers.
sentences.chinese: 超級兔看見了一羣人在捱餓，立刻用魔棒變出了食物。

sentences.english: Using the magic wand tool, select the empty zone of the house layer.
sentences.chinese: 使用魔棒工具，選擇房子那層的空白區域。

sentences.english: The magician waved his magic wand.
sentences.chinese: 那個魔術師揮舞着他的魔棒。

sentences.english: She waves her wand and makes Cinderellas dress beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 她揮了揮魔棒，便把灰姑娘的衣服變得很漂亮了。

sentences.english: The conjurer waved his magic wand and pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔術師揮動魔棒，便從帽子里拉出一隻兔子。

sentences.english: So where do we get this magic wand and crystal ball?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，我們到哪裏獲得這種魔棒和水晶玻璃球？

sentences.english: The fairy waved her magic wand at a big pumpkin.
sentences.chinese: 仙女向着大南瓜揮舞起了魔棒。

sentences.english: And people expect you have a magic wand to change things.
sentences.chinese: 人們希望我有一支魔棒，能改變這一切。

definition: bone structure and physiognomy/the strength observed in brushstrokes (Chinese calligraphy)
golden cudgel, weapon wielded by Sun Wukong in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
